brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate the performance of Analgesia/Nociception Index (ANI)
      measured at the end of surgery for the prediction of immediate postoperative pain in
      postoperative care unit in adult patients undergoing general anesthesia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Immediate Postoperative Pain Using Analgesia/Nociception Index (ANI)

detailed_description.textblock:
Assessment of the performance of ANI to predict immediate postoperative pain on a 0-10
      numerical rating scale (NRS) >3 by building a receiver operating characteristic curve.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult

          -  ear-nose-throat or orthopedic surgical procedures

          -  halogenated and remifentanil-based general anesthesia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age <18 yrs or >75 yrs

          -  arrythmia

          -  administration of anticholinergic drugs or neuromuscular blockade reversal in the 20
             previous minutes

          -  psychiatric diseases

          -  autonomic nervous system disorders (epilepsy)

          -  inability to understand the verbal rating pain scale

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients underoing surgical procedures performed on general anesthesia

clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Immediate Postoperative Pain Using Analgesia/Nociception Index (ANI): an Observational Study

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.measure: Analgesia/Nociception Index (ANI) receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve area under the curve (AUC) for the prediction of immediate postoperative pain
primary_outcome.time_frame: At day 0 at the end of surgery immediately before extubation for  ANI and  at arrival in postoperative care unit within 10 minutes after arrival

reference.citation: Boselli E, Daniela-Ionescu M, Bégou G, Bouvet L, Dabouz R, Magnin C, Allaouchiche B. Prospective observational study of the non-invasive assessment of immediate postoperative pain using the analgesia/nociception index (ANI). Br J Anaesth. 2013 Apr 16. [Epub ahead of print]
